Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] preprocessors
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=z7UxL3SWf-OM7yfVLkbBp-OKOfsIENNkXiyj1QXIiPDM
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Each set of decide-rules in a single Processor only help decide whether 
that one Processor should run. That is, if they report 'ACCEPT' or 
'PASS', that Processor is run. If 'REJECT', that Processor is skipped, 
but other processing continues.

Inside some of the standard Processors, as part of their analysis, they 
can force subsequent processors to be skipped up to the "postprocessing" 
phase.

For example, when (in H1) a CrawlURI does not pass the canFetch() test 
in FetchHTTP, the method CrawlURI.skipToProcessorChain() is used to 
ensure the CrawlURI skips forward to the wrapup-processing. This is 
independent on the configurable per-Processor decide-rules.

- Gordon @ IA

On 3/13/11 8:13 AM, Mohammad Amin Golshani wrote:
>
>
> hello

> **fetch-processors * be accepted? or after rejection in any preprocessor
> the URL completely rejected?
